conbody.p: The Service Manager (SM) provides services in an NCC network deployment to manage the network of MEs that provide the charging and other call-processing functions. The SM provides the entry point for external interfaces for GUI access and API gateway access for various sorts of operator IT systems and for mobile applications.

The SM is built on the same software infrastructure as the MEs. The primary differences are in the business logic in servicemanager pod on the SM, compared to charging pod on the ME, and any additional services to support each of those two applications. This shared foundation allows the SM to benefit from the same cloud-native architecture, and provides horizontal scalability and high performance in the SM.

All provisioning goes through the SM, whether through its GUI or its APIs. The SM manages and maintains a mapping of which subscribers/devices are homed on which MEs in the network as primary and secondary. The actual subscriber/device records are stored only on the MEs.
The SM GUI can be accessed using the Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, or Microsoft Edge web browser on the Windows platform.
